meanings.definition: Done quickly and without attention to detail.
meanings.sent1: She gave the report a cursorily glance before moving on to the next task.
meanings.sent2: The cursorily drawn map led us in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent3: The cursorily wrapped gift fell apart as soon as it was picked up.
meanings.sent4: His cursorily painted masterpiece lacked depth and emotion.
meanings.sent5: The cursorily built sandcastle crumbled with the first wave.

meanings.definition: In a hasty or superficial manner.
meanings.sent1: He only cursorily skimmed through the instructions before attempting to assemble the furniture.
meanings.sent2: She cursorily answered the question without fully understanding it.
meanings.sent3: The detective cursorily glanced at the evidence, missing a crucial clue.
meanings.sent4: The singer cursorily rehearsed the song, resulting in a lackluster performance.
meanings.sent5: The chef cursorily seasoned the dish, leaving it bland and unappetizing.
